p: In Australia, outbreaks associated with subgenogroup C1 were reported in Victoria in 1986 and subgenogroup C2 in Western Australia in 1999 [ 39]. A subgenogroup B4 epidemic was also reported in Sydney in 2000–2001 [ 39]. A switch from subgenogroup B4 to C4 in early 2013 was associated with a severe outbreak in Sydney (Table 1 and Fig. 3) [ 41].
